item.title: Tree between 20 and 22 Roderick Road, 18th November
item.description:
The tree on the pavement directly between 20 and 22 Roderick Road (even side) is diseased/dying. It never took to being pollarded a few years ago and fails to grow leaves except one branch, which quickly dies off. A fungus seems to have invaded most of the tree and I am worried it could topple.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roderick Road, Gospel Oak, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Galliard Homes have blocked entry/exit to Bromley Palace Park, 18th November
item.description:
Galliard Homes have erected Harris fencing to block people’s access to and exit from Bromley Palace Park. We have a right of way to our park (almost diagonally across the car park). We no longer have access. Please can action be taken immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Highbridge Wharf, Greenwich

item.title: Yester Road, Chislehurst short cut entrance to Camden Park Road, 18th November
item.description:
A few times a week I take a short cut from Yester Road where is a small entrance with a few steps leading down to Camden Park Road. I am really wary of stepping down each step (as I am in my 80s) as there is no handrail to hold on to. Recently returning from church I caught my foot as I stepped up but fortunately managed to save myself! If a small handrail could be fitted, myself and I am sure other folk, would be very grateful for this safety feature. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lubbock Road, Elmstead, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish regularly dumped., 18th November
item.description:
For many months, people from local flats in Lamb Walk and City Walk regularly dump bags, some not closed properly, as well as packaging. The bags are opened by the foxes, vermin and pigeons. The spillage caused then blows all over the streets and looks appalling. Whilst this is eventually cleared, it is a dreadful sight as people return to their homes. Clearly we need a Large Bin outside the Electric Sub Station, on the Morocco street side, which can be emptied regularly. Even a 'PLEASE DON'T DUMP RUBBISH' sign on the wall would be preferable to seeing this mess on a daily basis. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Lamb Walk, The Borough, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning gutter clearence, 18th November
item.description:
Yet again the street cleaning lorry just comes into the close missing out half of it just it just does a random circle in the middle and doesn’t go to edges getting fallen leaves and debris that block the gutters . It is a waste of time and money if the job is done properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Austral Close, Longlands, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
